title: Pavel Jose, PhD
text:
I help companies improve business decisions through statistical modeling — especially in settings where data is messy, opportunities for experimentation are limited, and off-the-shelf solutions fall short.
My focus areas include demand modeling, price elasticity estimation, and forecasting. I build bespoke models using Bayesian methods, tailored to the structure of the business problem — particularly when standard tools can’t capture the complexity of real-world decisions.
I’ve worked across B2C and B2B contexts in close collaboration with various stakeholders — always aiming to understand how the business and sales processes actually work, so models reflect what matters and make the most of limited data.
Open to freelance and consulting opportunities involving challenging modeling problems, including pricing optimization and marketing mix modeling.

title: Pavel Jose
text:
Hi, I’m Pavel Jose

I help businesses optimize prices and grow revenue with data. That means building models that make pricing decisions — not dashboards that sit unused.
Whether you’re a retailer, a B2B supplier, or a direct-to-consumer brand, I work with you (or your agency) to identify pricing opportunities, model demand, and implement pricing logic that scales.
I don’t just hand you elasticities — I deliver working solutions.
Get in touch if you’d like to work together.

title: Pavel Jose
text:
What I do


From pricing guesswork to pricing strategy.
I support clients with:

Price optimization (margin or revenue focused)
Willingness-to-pay modeling — even without clean sales data
Demand forecasting with uncertainty estimates
Stockout detection and adjustment
Competitor benchmarking from scraped or third-party data
A/B test design and analysis
Causal inference for pricing, marketing, and product decisions

I help you go from messy historical data to a robust pricing process.


Business-first. Technically fluent.
I build models that are:

Custom-fit to your context, not off-the-shelf
Designed for messy, real-world data
Delivered as ready-to-use pricing logic, files, or API endpoints

My goal is always the same: help you charge the right price — confidently, repeatedly, and at scale.
I’m based in Berlin and work with clients across Europe and North America.
I speak English, German, and Russian.

title: Pavel Jose
text:
Experience
I’ve worked with retailers, manufacturers, and global brands on pricing problems ranging from product launches to large-scale price realignments.
Past projects have included:

Rolling out optimized prices across 300+ stores
Replacing legacy price ladders with margin-based models
Estimating price elasticity across thousands of SKUs
Designing experiments to test pricing thresholds

Much of my work is done through agencies — but I operate as a partner, not a hired hand.

title: Profitable Pricing
text:
Why does it matter?
A 1% improvement in pricing typically has 2-4x the profit impact of a 1% improvement in volume. Yet most companies spend far more effort on sales and marketing than on getting their prices right.

title: Profitable Pricing
text:
Common pricing challenges

“We don’t have enough data”
You often have more useful data than you think. Transaction histories, competitor prices, customer segments, and even failed quotes contain pricing signals. Bayesian methods can extract insights from limited data by incorporating business knowledge.


“Our market is too complex”
Complex markets often mean more pricing opportunity, not less. When you sell thousands of SKUs across different regions, customer segments, or channels, there’s usually significant variation in willingness-to-pay that uniform pricing leaves on the table.


“We tried dynamic pricing and it didn’t work”
Most failed pricing initiatives suffer from poor implementation, not bad math. Prices that don’t account for inventory, competition, or customer perception will underperform regardless of the underlying model.

title: Profitable Pricing
text:
How I approach pricing projects

Understand the business context - How do sales actually happen? What constraints exist? What does “success” look like?
Assess the data - What pricing signals exist? What’s missing? How clean is it?
Build fit-for-purpose models - Custom models that match your specific situation, not off-the-shelf solutions forced to fit.
Deliver actionable outputs - Price recommendations you can actually use, not just elasticity estimates in a spreadsheet.
Measure and iterate - Track results and refine the approach based on real outcomes.
